definition: Jinsha river, upper reaches of Yangtze river or Changjiang 長江|长江 in Sichuan and Yunnan
surname Jin/surname Kim (Korean)/Jurchen Jin dynasty (1115-1234)
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
granule/hoarse/raspy/sand/powder/CL:粒[li4]/abbr. for Tsar or Tsarist Russia
surname Sha
river/CL:條|条[tiao2],道[dao4]
surname Jiang

sentences.english: Prior to GSR, Sonny was the co-founder of Asia Wireless Technology Corp.
sentences.chinese: 创立金沙江基金以前，伍伸俊是亚洲无线科技创始人。

sentences.english: It proves that the Jinshajiang suture zone could not have formed the main suture zone in the Paleo-Tethys domain.
sentences.chinese: 因此，金沙江带不能作为古特提斯域的主缝合带。

sentences.english: Qiaojia County, situated by the Jinsha River, is a typical mountain region in northeastern Yunnan Province.
sentences.chinese: 巧家县是云南省东北部金沙江畔的一个典型山区县。

sentences.english: I am down by Zhongshan Road and Songshan Road but I will go back up by Jinsha road.
sentences.chinese: 我中山北路和嵩山路，但我会去金沙江路备份。

sentences.english: Khan led his army to cross exposure and raft through the Jinsha River, unified Yunnan.
sentences.chinese: 元世祖率大军跨革囊及筏渡过金沙江，统一了云南。

sentences.english: Tell me where the Red Army Men cross the Jinsa river?
sentences.chinese: 告诉我红军是在什么地方渡过金沙江的？

sentences.english: This thesis hopes to offer the reference for hydropower cascade development and navigation planning in the Jinsha river.
sentences.chinese: 为金沙江流域的水电梯级开发和航运规划提供参考。

sentences.english: And this is where you start floating on the Jinsha River.
sentences.chinese: 图中是金沙江漂流的起点。

sentences.english: As the largest tributary of Jinsha river, Yalong river is abundant in hydropower resources.
sentences.chinese: 雅砻江是金沙江的最大支流，水力资源十分丰富。

sentences.english: Village is on Jinsha River's cliff.
sentences.chinese: 村庄就在金沙江边的悬崖之上。

sentences.english: Another power station is being built on the Jinsha River.
sentences.chinese: 金沙江上将修建另一座电站。

definition: Yalong river of Tibet and Sichuan
Dadu River in Sichuan
Nujiang river of south Tibet and northwest Yunnan, the upper reaches of Salween river 薩爾溫江|萨尔温江, forming border of Myanmar and Thailand
Chishui River, tributary of Wei in Shaanxi
Lancang River of Qinghai and Yunnan, the upper reaches of Mekong River 湄公河[Mei2 gong1 He2] of Southeast Asia
Irrawaddy or Ayeyarwaddy River, the main river of Myanmar (Burma)
Min River, Sichuan

Three Parallel Rivers National Park, in mountainous northwest Yunnan World Heritage protected area: the three rivers are Nujian 怒江 or Salween, Jinsha 金沙江 or upper reaches of Changjiang and Lancang 澜沧江 or Mekong
Yarlung Tsangpo River, Tibet
Mt Haba (Nakhi: golden flower), in Lijiang 麗江|丽江, northwest Yunnan
Salween river, flowing from Tibet into Myanmar
Yajiang county (Tibetan: nyag chu rdzong) in Garze Tibetan autonomous prefecture 甘孜藏族自治州, Sichuan (formerly in Kham province of Tibet)
Hengduan mountains, several parallel mountain ranges on the border between west Yunnan and Sichuan and east Tibet
Suijiang county in Zhaotong 昭通[Zhao1 tong1], Yunnan
Tiger Leaping Gorge on the Jinsha River 金沙江[Jin1 sha1 jiang1] in Lijiang Naxi autonomous county 麗江納西族自治縣|丽江纳西族自治县[Li4 jiang1 Na4 xi1 zu2 Zi4 zhi4 xian4], Yunnan
Luding county (Tibetan: lcags zam rdzong) in Garze Tibetan autonomous prefecture 甘孜藏族自治州[Gan1 zi1 Zang4 zu2 zi4 zhi4 zhou1], Sichuan (formerly in Kham province of Tibet)
